page.title: 03Playschool meeting place.
page.content: The Wildwood Community Centre opened in September 1982, taking nine months to build. The previous centre was old and falling apart. It cost 17000 pounds to rebuild (originally being offices). There are two rooms in the centre, the smaller costing 4 pounds per hour to hire and the larger 5 pounds. About 120 people a day use the centre, the most popular club being playschool. The new community centre is used for all sorts of things besides playschool e.g. discos, parties, bingo, aerobics, keepfit, ballroom, tap and ballet dancing, W.I., church meetings, elections and wedding receptions. The committee had a series of fund-raising events e.g. jumble sales etc. to help build the centre and it is mainly used by locals.
